definitions: to put a limit on (expenditure, etc.)
to follow or outdo with a story, remark, etc.
to complete or crown (an achievement or a career) with something notable
to provide (a tooth) with a crown
examples: The government decided to cap the budget.
He tried to cap her story with an even wilder one.
Winning the championship capped his career.
The dentist will cap the damaged tooth.
The gangster threatened to cap him.
